title: Help Identifying this script face (not Snell or Bernhard)
content:
Hello,

I'm having trouble recognizing the script that Delman shoes is using on their web site. Three samples attached, site URL below.

[http://delmanshoes.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804050132/http:/delmanshoes.com/ "http://delmanshoes.com/")

Does it look familiar to anyone? Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo-banner-right.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804050132/http:/typophile.com/files/logo-banner-right.jpg) | 3.45 KB |
| [logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804050132/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_55.jpg) | 4 KB |
| [main.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804050132/http:/typophile.com/files/main.jpg) | 46.69 KB |
author: Cranialtorque

comments.content: All the samples but the logo are [Snell Roundhand Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804050132/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/snell-roundhand/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26seed%3D29%26dock%3D0%26size%3D25%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dshop%2520Sign%2520legacy%252010%2525%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dsingle%252Cot.liga). The logo is something different, quite possibly old and custom drawn for the logo.

It is Snell roundhand Bold, you are correct!

I guess I was thrown by the Custom wordmark, and wasn't paying close enough attention. I feel silly now.

Thanks for the help!
